alert.note: Alert for Northern Wasatch Front (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 11 at 11:07PM MDT until further notice by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Utah... The Lower Weber River At Plain City affecting Northern Wasatch Front zone. .Increased river flows will continue due to a combination of snowmelt and upstream dam releases. ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Near minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...The Lower Weber River At Plain City. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, flooding will occur along the levee system near Plain City, affecting local farmland adjacent to the Weber River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 22.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is forecast to see increasing stage through the next week or more, potentially reaching flood stage depending on snowmelt and upstream dam releases. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
